pgTitle: List of United States servicemembers and civilians missing in action during the Vietnam War (1970–71)

rows.text: Passenger on U-6A #52-25884 that disappeared while flying from Qui Nhon to Buôn Ma Thuột city
Passenger on U-6A #52-25884 that disappeared while flying from Qui Nhon to Buôn Ma Thuột city
Passenger on U-6A #52-25884 that disappeared while flying from Qui Nhon to Buôn Ma Thuột city
Passenger on U-6A #52-25884 that disappeared while flying from Qui Nhon to Buôn Ma Thuột city
Passenger on U-6A #52-25884 that disappeared while flying from Qui Nhon to Buôn Ma Thuột city
Pilot of U-6A #52-25884 that disappeared while flying from Qui Nhon to Buôn Ma Thuột city
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Mortally wounded during an ambush while leading a FANK unit on a training exercise
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of F-4E #68-0288 hit by enemy fire and crashed at sea. Both cremen ejected successfully, but only the weapons systems officer was rescued
Killed in action, body not recovered
His A-4F #154930 went into the sea when the catapult failed
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered

Pilot of F-4D #66-8777 shot down while dropping sensors on the Ho Chi Minh Trail, both crewmen ejected and he radioed that he was surrounded by enemy forces and had been shot. The weapons systems officer Major Norbert A. Gotner was capture and released in 1973
Copilot of AH-1G #66-15340 that crashed into a mountain-side in low cloud, the helicopter exploded and caught fire. SAR forces recovered the remains of the pilot W1 Carl M. Wood
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Copilot of a CH-47C #67-18506 hit by ground fire while transporting fuel bladders to a forward base, the fuel bladders exploded causing the helicopter to explode and crash
Killed in action, body not recovered
Weapons systems officer on an F-4D #66-8750 hit by enemy fire and crashed on a night bombing mission
Pilot of an F-4D #66-8750 hit by enemy fire and crashed on a night bombing mission

Pilot of UH-1H #68-15255 shot down while extracting members of MACV-SOG team RT Intruder. The helicopter crashed in flames. Another MACV-SOG team RT Habu rappelled into the crash site the following day and gathered the remains of the crew and passengers in body bags for extraction, but RT Habu was attacked by enemy forces and had to extract leaving the bodies behind
Killed in action, body not recovered
Crew chief on UH-1H #68-15255 shot down while extracting members of MACV-SOG team RT Intruder
Killed in action, body not recovered
Door gunner on UH-1H #68-15255 shot down while extracting members of MACV-SOG team RT Intruder
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Leader of RT Intruder being extracted by STABO rig beneath UH-1H #68-15255 when it was shot down
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of UH-1H #68-15255 shot down while extracting members of MACV-SOG team RT Intruder
Killed in action, body not recovered
Door gunner on a UH-1C gunship #66–700 shot down while providing air cover for a resupply mission
Crew chief on a UH-1C gunship #66–700 shot down while providing air cover for a resupply mission
Killed in action, body not recovered
Door gunner/observer on OH-6A #67-16256 shot down on a low-level reconnaissance mission
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of F-4J that lost power to one engine on a night launch and went into the sea. The radar intercept officer was rescued
Killed in action, body not recovered
Artillery forward observer attached to an ARVN unit, he disappeared when the unit was overrun by enemy forces
Advisor to the 22nd ARVN Ranger Battalion, killed by mortar fire in an ambush, his body was left behind during the evacuation
Killed in action, body not recovered
Advisor to the 22nd ARVN Ranger Battalion, killed by mortar fire in an ambush, his body was left behind during the evacuation
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Crewman on JU21-A #67-18062 LEFT JAB aircraft that disappeared on an intelligence gathering flight near the DMZ
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of JU21-A #67-18062 LEFT JAB aircraft that disappeared on an intelligence gathering flight near the DMZ
Killed in action, body not recovered
Technical Observer on JU21-A #67-18062 LEFT JAB aircraft that disappeared on an intelligence gathering flight near the DMZ
Killed in action, body not recovered
Crewman on JU21-A #67-18062 LEFT JAB aircraft that disappeared on an intelligence gathering flight near the DMZ
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of AH-1G #67-15464 that disappeared while returning from an SAR mission
Co-pilot of AH-1G #67-15464 that disappeared while returning from an SAR mission
Observer on OH-6A #67-16645 that was part of a Pink Team hit by enemy fire, crashed and burned, no survivors observed
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of OH-6A #67-16645 that was part of a Pink Team hit by enemy fire, crashed and burned, no survivors observed
Killed in action, body not recovered

Door gunner on OH-6A #67-17412 shot down on a visual reconnaissance mission and crashed in flames into a river. The remains of the crew chief SP4 Robert Kiser were recovered by SAR forces, while the pilot WO1 Craig J. Houser survived and made contact with friendly forces
His F-100D #56-3415 crashed while on a close air support mission

His A-7E #157589 was hit by ground fire and he ejected breaking an arm and a leg. He made contact with SAR forces but they were unable to rescue him due to heavy ground fire, his last radio transmission indicated he was about to be captured.
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of UH-1H #69-15664that was shot down while inserting ARVN troops, he was last seen evading enemy troops
Crew Chief on UH-1H #69-15664 that was shot down while inserting ARVN troops, he was last seen to be wounded and evading enemy troops
Copilot of AH-1G #69-17935 shot down on a visual reconnaissance mission, ARVN forces found his body but were unable to evacuate it due to heavy enemy fire
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of O-2A #68-6860 shot down on a forward air control mission
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of UH-1C gunship #65-9489 shot down while on an armed escort mission
Crew Chief on UH-1C gunship #65-9489 shot down while on an armed escort mission
Copilot of UH-1C gunship #65-9489 shot down while on an armed escort mission
Pilot of a UH-1H #68-15759 shot down while on a resupply mission to ARVN troops, the helicopter exploded and burned on the ground, none of the crew was seen to escape
Killed in action, body not recovered
Door gunner on a UH-1H #68-15759 shot down while on a resupply mission to ARVN troops
Killed in action, body not recovered
Crew chief a UH-1H #68-15759 shot down while on a resupply mission to ARVN troops
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of a UH-1H #68-15759 shot down while on a resupply mission to ARVN troops
Killed in action, body not recovered
His F-100D was hit by ground fire and exploded
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed by an enemy grenade when his patrol was ambushed near the DMZ and his body was unable to be recovered due to enemy presence
Killed in action, body not recovered
Shot and wounded when his patrol was ambushed near the DMZ, he was left behind when the unit withdrew
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed by an enemy grenade when his patrol was ambushed near the DMZ. His body was unable to be recovered due to enemy presence
Killed in action, body not recovered
fire support base Number 6 on Hill 1001 was overrun
Died in captivity, remains not returned

Member of integrated observation systems team taken prisoner after fire support base Number 6 on Hill 1001 was overrun by elements of the 66th NVA Regiment. Sgt David F Allwine who was released in Operation Homecoming reported that Sp$ Terrill died of wounds within days of his capture
Died in captivity, remains not returned
Killed in action, body not recovered
His A-1H Skyraider #137628 crashed into the ground in low cloud while on an SAR mission
Killed in action, body not recovered
Member of a long range reconnaissance patrol ambushed by enemy forces, after 2 days of battle he left the team's perimeter to get water and disappeared
Pilot of F-4D #66-7616 that crashed and burned on a night escort strike mission, no ejections observed
Weapons systems Officer on F-4D #66-7616 that crashed and burned on a night escort strike mission, no ejections observed

Passenger aboard a UH-1H helicopter in which his unit was about to conduct a helicopter inserted near the Laotian border, he was hit by enemy fire, fell from the hovering helicopter and was last seen lying on the ground

Member of 6-man reconnaissance team Asp that was inserted near the Vietnam/Laos border on 3 May. Radio contact with the team was lost on 4 May. The remains of the 3rd American team member SFC Lewis C. Walton were identified in 2006
Member of 6-man reconnaissance team Asp that was inserted near the Vietnam/Laos border on 3 May. Radio contact with the team was lost on 4 May

Crew chief on a UH-1H shot down after inserting ARVN Marines, the helicopter burnt on impact. SAR forces were inserted 8 days later but were unable to evacuate all remains from the burnt wreckage due to heavy enemy fire. The remains of the 4th crewman, SP4 Timothy J Jacobsen, were identified in 2008.
Copilot of UH-1H shot down after inserting ARVN Marines, the helicopter burnt on impact
Copilot of UH-1H shot down after inserting ARVN Marines, the helicopter burnt on impact
Copilot of UH-1H #67-17607 shot down while attempting to extract RT Alaska. He was killed in the crash but the SAR team was unable to extract his body from the wreckage
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of UH-1H #67-17607 shot down while attempting to extract RT Alaska. He escaped the crashed helicopter, but disappeared
Leader of RT Alaska inserted into the Da Krong Valley on 8 May. On 17 May the team was ambushed and called for extraction, he was wounded and remained behind as the team moved to the evacuation point
Gunner on an OH-6A hit by an RPG while on a hunter-killer mission. The accompanying UH-1C gunships saw no-one escape the burning wreckage
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of OH-6A hit by an RPG while on a hunter-killer mission
Killed in action, body not recovered
Wounded and disappeared when NVA forces overran radio relay post on Hill 950 Hickory Hill
Killed in action, body not recovered
His truck crashed off a bridge into a river and his body was washed away
Killed in action, body not recovered
Crewman on an EKA-3B #147649 that crashed on launch
Killed in action, body not recovered
Copilot of EKA-3B #147649 that crashed on launch
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of EKA-3B #147649 that crashed on launch
Killed in action, body not recovered
His F-8J crashed into the sea
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed with 3 other soldiers when the explosives on the truck they were unloading exploded, no identifiable remains of SP4 Bridges were recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Observer on OV-10A #67-14634 lost in poor weather on a visual reconnaissance mission
Pilot of OV-10A #67-14634 lost in poor weather on a visual reconnaissance mission
Pilot of AH-1G #67-15674 that suffered mechanical failure and crashed into the Quang Tri River. As he was being rescued he fell into the river and drowned
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of UH-1H #68-15671 shot down on an extraction mission. SAR forces were unable to extract his body from the wreckage due to heavy enemy presence
Killed in action, body not recovered

Observer on an OH-6A #68-17257 shot down while on a reconnaissance mission. SAR forces confirmed he was dead but were unable to extract his body and that of the gunner SP4 Randall Dalton due to enemy activity, when SAR forces returned the next day his and Dalton's bodies had disappeared. In 1989 the remains of SP4 Dalton were returned, but these were not identified until 2011
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of O-1G #51-2267 which crashed while conducting a visual reconnaissance mission and caught fire
Observer on O-1G #51-2267 which crashed while conducting a visual reconnaissance mission and caught fire
Killed in action, body not recovered
Drowned while attempting to assist PFC Willie Kuykendall
Killed in action, body not recovered
Weapons systems operator on F-4E #68-0316 that crashed on a daytime visual reconnaissance mission
Pilot of F-4E #68-0316 that crashed on a daytime visual reconnaissance mission
Pilot of AH-1G #67-15752 that crashed in bad weather and caught fire. SAR forces recovered the remains of the copilot 1st Lieutenant Danny A. Cowan
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
US Army Element Vietnam Army-Air Force Regional Exchange
Passenger on CH-47B #66-19143 that crashed at sea
Killed in action, body not recovered
Gunner on CH-47B #66-19143 that crashed at sea
Killed in action, body not recovered
Flight engineer on CH-47B #66-19143 that crashed at sea
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Copilot of CH-47B #66-19143 that crashed at sea
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of F-4E #69-7562 that crashed, no ejection or parachutes observed
Weapons system operator on F-4E #69-7562 that crashed, no ejection or parachutes observed

Pararescueman on Jolly Green 70, CH-53 #68-10366 that was hit by ground fire and crashed into the Song Na River. 2 crewmen survived the crash and the bodies of 3 other crewmen were recovered from the wreckage
Weapons system officer on F-4D #66-7752 that disappeared on a night forward air control mission
Pilot of F-4D #66-7752 that disappeared on a night forward air control mission

Pilot of F105G #63-8326 hit by a SAM while on a Wild Weasel mission. Both crewmen ejected successfully, SAR forces recovered the weapons system officer Major Robert Belli and observed Lt Col McIntire's body hanging lifeless in his parachute from a tree, but were unable to recover his body due to enemy fire
Killed in action, body not recovered
Passenger on U-21A #66-18041 that suffered engine failure and disappeared on a flight from Phu Bai to Danang
Killed in action, body not recovered
Passenger on U-21A #66-18041 that disappeared on a flight from Phu Bai to Danang
Killed in action, body not recovered
Passenger on U-21A #66-18041 that disappeared on a flight from Phu Bai to Danang
Killed in action, body not recovered
Passenger on U-21A #66-18041 that disappeared on a flight from Phu Bai to Danang
Killed in action, body not recovered
Copilot of U-21A #66-18041 that disappeared on a flight from Phu Bai to Danang
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of U-21A #66-18041 that disappeared on a flight from Phu Bai to Danang
Killed in action, body not recovered

Copilot of OH-6A #67-16347 shot down on a bomb damage assessment mission. The helicopter exploded in flames and the bodies of both crewmen were seen on the ground but could not be recovered due to strong enemy fire
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of OH-6A #67-16347 shot down on a bomb damage assessment mission
Killed in action, body not recovered
Copilot of OV-10A #67-14667 that disappeared on a night forward air control mission
Pilot of OV-10A #67-14667 that disappeared on a night forward air control mission
Pilot of C-123K #6293 that was shot down on a flight from Udorn, Thailand to Ban Xieng Lom
Copilot of C-123K #6293 that was shot down on a flight from Udorn, Thailand to Ban Xieng Lom
Kicker on C-123K #6293 that was shot down on a flight from Udorn, Thailand to Ban Xieng Lom
Pilot of an A-6A hit by a SAM, the copilot ejected successfully and was rescued
Pilot of F-4D #66-7573 lost on a night interdiction mission
Weapons system operator on F-4D #66-7573 lost on a night interdiction mission
